qas.question: What is the capital of Bermuda?
What spin-off company took over operations in Bermuda in 1615?
In what year did Bermuda enter British rule?
What is the name of the company that managed the colony from 1615-1684?
In what year did the islands become a British colony?
What event occured that automatically ranked Bermuda as the oldest remaining British Overseas Territory?
What company was the spin-off of Somers Isles Company?
Who took over the colony from Virginia in 1614?

plausible_answers.text: The islands became a British colony

qas.question: When was China returned to Hong Kong?

context: The island was administered as an extension of <b7_0>Virginia<b7_0/> by the Company until 1614. Its spin-off, <a3_0>the <a1_0><b8_0><b9_0>Somers Isles Company<b9_0/><b8_0/><a3_0/><a1_0/>, took over in 1615 and managed the colony until 1684. At that time, the company's charter was revoked, and the English Crown took over administration. <b10_0>The islands became a British colony<b10_0/> following the <a2_0><a4_0>1707<a4_0/><a2_0/> unification of the parliaments of Scotland and England, which created the Kingdom of Great Britain. After 1949, when <a5_0>Newfoundland became part of Canada<a5_0/>, Bermuda was automatically ranked as the oldest remaining British Overseas Territory. Since the return of Hong Kong to China in <b11_0>1997<b11_0/>, it is the most populous Territory. Its first capital, <a0_0><a6_0>St. George<a6_0/>'s<a0_0/>, was established in 1612 and is the oldest continuously inhabited English town in the New World.
